# Project Context
this project is a tools for automation of create machines in vsphere environment
# Coding Guidelines
- Follow consistent naming conventions for variables, functions, and classes.
- Write clear and concise comments to explain complex logic.
- Ensure code is modular and reusable.
- Adhere to best practices for error handling and logging.
- Maintain consistent formatting and indentation throughout the codebase.
- Write unit tests for new features and bug fixes.
- Use version control effectively, with meaningful commit messages.
- Prioritize performance and scalability in code design.
- Ensure compatibility with existing systems and libraries used in the project.
- Follow security best practices to protect sensitive data and prevent vulnerabilities. 
- Regularly review and refactor code to improve quality and maintainability.
- Document APIs and interfaces clearly for ease of use by other developers.
- Stay updated with the latest developments in relevant technologies and incorporate them when appropriate.
- Collaborate effectively with team members through code reviews and discussions.
- Use configuration files for environment-specific settings instead of hardcoding values.
- Optimize resource usage to minimize costs in the vsphere environment.
- Ensure that the code adheres to the principles of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) where applicable.
- Leverage existing libraries and tools to avoid reinventing the wheel.
- Test code in a staging environment before deploying to production.
- Follow the DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) principle to reduce redundancy in code.
- Use meaningful and descriptive names for functions and variables to enhance code readability.
- Ensure that all dependencies are up to date and compatible with the project.
- Implement logging and monitoring to track the performance and health of the automated systems.
- Follow a consistent branching strategy in version control to manage features, bug fixes, and releases.
- Prioritize user experience when designing interfaces or interactions within the tool.
- Ensure that the code is compliant with relevant industry standards and regulations.
- Use automated tools for code quality checks, such as linters and formatters.
- Encourage continuous learning and improvement among team members to keep skills sharp and relevant.
- Foster a culture of open communication and knowledge sharing within the team.
- Regularly update documentation to reflect changes in the codebase and project requirements.
- Plan for scalability and future growth when designing system architecture.

- when you generate code please use terraform modules where applicable.
- when you generate code please use proper indentation and formatting for better readability.
- when you generate code please avoid hardcoding values, use variables instead.
- when you generate code please include necessary resource dependencies to ensure proper resource creation order.
